item.title: NPM Modules in OpenWhisk
item.description: OpenWhisk now supports creating Node.js Actions from a zip file. The archive file will be extracted into the runtime environment by the platform. This allows us to split microservice logic across multiple files, use third-party NPM modules or include non-JavaScript assets (configuration files, images, HTML files). “Hello World” Example Let’s look at a “Hello World” example of registering a serverless function from a zip file. Our archive will contain two files, the package descriptor and a JavaScript file.
